u16 PA_FatEasyCreateGfx (u8 screen, const char *name, u8 obj_shape, u8 obj_size, u8 color_mode)
 Easiest way to load sprite gfx from FAT into VRAM for later use. Returns the gfx's number in memory. Sprites should be converted with PAGfx.
void PA_FatLoadTexture (u8 slot, const char *name)
 Load a texture from FAT into regular RAM for 3d sprites. Textures should be converted with PAGfx.
void PA_FatFreeTexture (u8 slot)
 Remove a texture from RAM (but not VRAM).
u16 PA_FatEasy3DCreateTex (const char *name, u16 width, u16 height, u8 type)
 Easiest way to load a texture for 3D sprites from FAT into VRAM for later use. Returns the gfx's number in memory. Textures should be converted with PAGfx.

Detailed Description

Load graphics or audio assets from FAT (EFS or regular FAT with DLDI) to RAM and then use them. Includes a slot-based management system for shadowed assets in RAM and a bebug error message system. These functions are provided by NightFox.

Function Documentation

void PA_FatBgLoad ( const char *  reference,
const char *  name 
)

Load a background from FAT into RAM and set up a reference for it.

Parameters:
reference Reference name to assign the background
name Name of the background stored in FAT (can be the same as the reference name)

inline s16 PA_FatEasy3DCreateTex ( const char *  name,
u16  width,
u16  height,
u8  type 
) [inline]

Easiest way to load a texture for 3D sprites from FAT into VRAM for later use. Returns the gfx's number in memory. Textures should be converted with PAGfx.

Parameters:
name Name of the texture to load from FAT
width Texture width. Must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128, etc...)
height Texture height. Must be a factor of two (2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128, etc...)
type Color type. You can use the TEX_256COL, TEX_16COL, TEX_4COL (etc...) macros.

inline void PA_FatEasyBgLoad ( u8  screen,
u8  bg_select,
const char *  name 
) [inline]

Easiest way to load a background from FAT and display it on the screen. Backgrounds should be converted with PAGfx.

Parameters:
screen Screen (0 or 1)
bg_select Background number (0-3)
name Name of the background stored in FAT

inline u16 PA_FatEasyCreateGfx ( u8  screen,
const char *  name,
u8  obj_shape,
u8  obj_size,
u8  color_mode 
) [inline]

Easiest way to load sprite gfx from FAT into VRAM for later use. Returns the gfx's number in memory. Sprites should be converted with PAGfx.

Parameters:
screen Screen (0 or 1)
name Name of the sprite to load from FAT
obj_shape Object shape. You can use the OBJ_SIZE_32X32 (etc.) macros for object shape and obj_size...
obj_size Object size. You can use the OBJ_SIZE_32X32 ( etc.) macros for object shape and obj_size...
color_mode 256 or 16 color mode (1 or 0).

inline void PA_FatEasyCreateSprite ( u8  screen,
u8  obj_number,
const char *  name,
u8  obj_shape,
u8  obj_size,
u8  color_mode,
u8  palette,
s16  x,
s16  y 
) [inline]

Easiest way to load a sprite palette from FAT and display it on the screen. Sprites should be converted with PAGfx.

Parameters:
screen Screen (0 or 1)
obj_number Object number you want to use (0-127 for each screen seperately)
name Name of the sprite to load from FAT
obj_shape Object shape. You can use the OBJ_SIZE_32X32 (etc.) macros for object shape and obj_size...
obj_size Object size. You can use the OBJ_SIZE_32X32 ( etc.) macros for object shape and obj_size...
color_mode 256 or 16 color mode (1 or 0).
palette Palette to use (0-15).
x X axis position of sprite
y Y axis position of sprite

inline void PA_FatEasyLoad3DSpritePal ( u8  palette_num,
const char *  name 
) [inline]

Easiest way to load a 3D sprite palette from FAT into VRAM for direct use. Palette files will be generated when converting a sprite in PAGfx.

Parameters:
palette_num Palette number (0-15, per screen)
name Name of the palette to load from FAT

inline void PA_FatEasyLoadSpritePal ( u8  screen,
u8  palette_num,
const char *  name 
) [inline]

Easiest way to load a sprite palette from FAT into VRAM for direct use. Palette files will be generated when converting a sprite in PAGfx.

Parameters:
screen screen (0 or 1)
palette_num Palette number (0-15, per screen)
name Name of the palette to load from FAT

inline void PA_FatEasyPlaySfx ( const char *  name  )  [inline]

Easiest way to play a RAW sound effect from FAT. (This function is currently not working perfectly. PA_FatLoadSfx and PA_FatPlaySfx are the preferred method.).

Parameters:
name Name of sound stored in FAT
